page.title: 07ASH DISPOSAL WORKS
page.content: The Ash Disposal Works is situated two Kilometres East of Cridling Stubbs, which is on the Western side of the area The Ash Disposal Works Site has been open for Fifteen years,and in that time there has been about 16.5 million Cubic Metres of waste been dumped. There are no chemicals being dumped on the site, just ash and other waste from the Power Station at Eggborough. The lorries do not have far to travel, the power station is only a few miles away. The reason why the site was chosen at Cridling Stubbs is because of the easy access to the Motorway and other roads. The ash which is loaded on to the lorries is taken to builders all over Yorkshire and is used for crusher run on the roads and Motorways.
